meanings.sent1: The angry mob was incitable and ready to cause trouble.
meanings.sent2: The protest became incitable when the police arrived.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was so incitable, it kept chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an incitable spark that ignited a heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The incitable tension in the room could be felt by everyone present.

meanings.sent1: The controversial article was incitable and stirred up strong emotions.
meanings.sent2: His incitable behavior often led to conflicts with his peers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's incitable jokes made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The incitable music had everyone on the dance floor in no time.
meanings.sent5: The incitable speech inspired a wave of activism among the listeners.
